speaker: ARTEMIDORUS
text_entry: SCENE IV. Another part of the same street, before the house of BRUTUS.

speaker: ARTEMIDORUS
text_entry: Enter PORTIA and LUCIUS

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: I prithee, boy, run to the senate-house;

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: Stay not to answer me, but get thee gone:

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: Why dost thou stay?

speaker: LUCIUS
text_entry: To know my errand, madam.

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: I would have had thee there, and here again,

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: Ere I can tell thee what thou shouldst do there.

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: O constancy, be strong upon my side,

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: Set a huge mountain 'tween my heart and tongue!

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: I have a man's mind, but a woman's might.

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: How hard it is for women to keep counsel!

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: Art thou here yet?

speaker: LUCIUS
text_entry: Madam, what should I do?

speaker: LUCIUS
text_entry: Run to the Capitol, and nothing else?

speaker: LUCIUS
text_entry: And so return to you, and nothing else?

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: Yes, bring me word, boy, if thy lord look well,

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: For he went sickly forth: and take good note

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: What Caesar doth, what suitors press to him.

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: Hark, boy! what noise is that?

speaker: LUCIUS
text_entry: I hear none, madam.

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: Prithee, listen well;

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: I heard a bustling rumour, like a fray,

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: And the wind brings it from the Capitol.

speaker: LUCIUS
text_entry: Sooth, madam, I hear nothing.

speaker: LUCIUS
text_entry: Enter the Soothsayer

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: Come hither, fellow: which way hast thou been?

speaker: Soothsayer
text_entry: At mine own house, good lady.

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: What is't o'clock?

speaker: Soothsayer
text_entry: About the ninth hour, lady.

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: Is Caesar yet gone to the Capitol?

speaker: Soothsayer
text_entry: Madam, not yet: I go to take my stand,

speaker: Soothsayer
text_entry: To see him pass on to the Capitol.

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: Thou hast some suit to Caesar, hast thou not?

speaker: Soothsayer
text_entry: That I have, lady: if it will please Caesar

speaker: Soothsayer
text_entry: To be so good to Caesar as to hear me,

speaker: Soothsayer
text_entry: I shall beseech him to befriend himself.

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: Why, know'st thou any harm's intended towards him?

speaker: Soothsayer
text_entry: None that I know will be, much that I fear may chance.

speaker: Soothsayer
text_entry: Good morrow to you. Here the street is narrow:

speaker: Soothsayer
text_entry: The throng that follows Caesar at the heels,

speaker: Soothsayer
text_entry: Of senators, of praetors, common suitors,

speaker: Soothsayer
text_entry: Will crowd a feeble man almost to death:

speaker: Soothsayer
text_entry: I'll get me to a place more void, and there

speaker: Soothsayer
text_entry: Speak to great Caesar as he comes along.

speaker: Soothsayer
text_entry: Exit

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: I must go in. Ay me, how weak a thing

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: The heart of woman is! O Brutus,

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: The heavens speed thee in thine enterprise!

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: Sure, the boy heard me: Brutus hath a suit

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: That Caesar will not grant. O, I grow faint.

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: Run, Lucius, and commend me to my lord;

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: Say I am merry: come to me again,

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: And bring me word what he doth say to thee.

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: Exeunt severally
